whatIs.title: What is Kakebo and what is it for?
whatIs.p1: <bold>Kakebo</bold> is a Japanese savings method based on tracking your expenses and reviewing your month with intention. It's not about fancy charts, it's about seeing the obvious: where your money goes and what you can tweak without living like a hermit.
whatIs.p2: In practice, it works because it forces you to do three things most people avoid: <bold>track</bold>, <bold>categorize</bold>, and <bold>review</bold>. If you are consistent, you improve your spending control almost without realizing it.

faqSchema.a1: Yes, Kakebo has a free-forever plan that allows you to manage your monthly expenses at no cost. Ideal for starting with the Kakebo method.
faqSchema.q2: How does the Kakebo method work?
faqSchema.a2: It relies on manually tracking expenses, categorizing them into 4 groups (Survival, Leisure, Culture, Extra), and reflecting on them at the end of the month. It is more conscious than an automatic banking app.
faqSchema.q3: Is it better than an expense Excel?
faqSchema.a3: Kakebo gives you the best of Excel (privacy, control) but with a fast mobile interface, automatic analysis, and smart predefined categories.

step4.title: Review and adjust

article1.title: What is the Kakebo method?
article1.p: <bold>Kakebo</bold> (pronounced "kah-keh-boh") is the Japanese art of saving money. It is not just an expense tracker app; it is a philosophy that invites you to reflect on your spending habits. Kakebo adapts this century-old method to the digital age for users in <bold>Europe</bold> and beyond.

article2.title: Smart savings in Euros
article2.p: Designed specifically for economic management in <bold>Euros (‚Ç¨)</bold>, our platform allows you to categorize vital expenses (Survival), enjoy life (Leisure and Vice), cultivate your mind (Culture), and foresee unforeseen events (Extra). It's the ideal tool for those looking for a <bold>free personal finance app</bold> that works.
